Heya, folks!

The last day of idleness before I disappear again into the darkness of RL. There are many many builds with this class combo, yet none that go for the maximum possible DevCrit DC, well not quite the maximum as he's not a Half-Orc, but I tried to focus on AB and STR, rather than going for EDR or CON enhancements, like most of the other ones I saw, ending up with the highest STR of its kind. He gets lots of pre-epic feats, so he's proficient with bows and especially in melee, able to disarm and KD many foes. Can turn on IPA against those low AC - high DR mobs, or IE against those high AB - low AC mobs. I Haven't come up with a name yet, but I will before posting it. posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
Then that would be DevCrit DC of 46. Right?

Would you be willing to settle for DC 45, Max? If you would, I believe you can find 3 spare feats and DevCrit with two different weapons. True. Your AB for longbow is a bit pedestrian, but unless the enemy is extremely high AC all it takes is one out of the four APR hitting each round. How lucky is your dwarf? *lol* Actually, WS in longbow is probably a waste since your AB won't be all that reliable. So why try to inflict damage with a bow under those circumstances? And without a Mighty +16 long bow, you'll be getting gipped big time. IMO, I'd draw out the bow and start plunking from distance, hoping to crit and beat their fort (with Imp Crit in LB, chances will increase a bit). Any gremlins that get through into melee range, park the bow and start to wail with your tried-and-true dwarf's companion. After all, who ever heard of a REAL dwarf pretending to be an elf shooting pointy sticks?

Just an idea. I've seen DevCrit bowyers before (mainly AA/RDD's) but never were they combo'd with another DevCrit weapon. Have you? (BTW, maybe you are aware... maybe not...DevCrit does NOT need weapon focus. The in-game description lies.)

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Good suggestions, Hip.

The DC would be 46, 52 with Capped STR (which is attainable where I play)

The bow focus is almost of no use, except on WoG you kinda need to snipe things cuz of the remade AI, which won't gang up on ya if you shoot one of their members (basically, by sniping stuff, you pull them away from the pack), and that's why I took those feats (that and the fact I had virtually nothing else to take). I thought of doing something like a dual-wielding devcritter of 2 weapons, like the Dwarven Waraxe and a Kukri on the offhand, but then I would need 15 dex so I forgot about it. IDK about the bow devcrit because I generally just snipe a bit to pull enemies out then switch to melee to finish them off. However, as usual, that's a good insight. There are many feats to spare, as most of them are taken just because Fighter is used pre-epic for 30 BAB. I also considered taking Iron Will, Luck of Heroes and those kinds of feats instead of the bow focus, but decided not to because immunities are better.

I am aware that DC doesn't need WF, don't worry, so you can pretty much just pick 3 pre-epic feats that aren't requirements and drop them, IPA, IE, Disarm and Improved Disarm, there are many droppable feats, if anyone wants to DevCrit with the bow, then just pick 3 of them

Take it EZ!

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
Maximillian Kane wrote:IDK about the bow devcrit because I generally just snipe a bit to pull enemies out then switch to melee to finish them off. However, as usual, that's a good insight. There are many feats to spare, as most of them are taken just because Fighter is used pre-epic for 30 BAB. I also considered taking Iron Will, Luck of Heroes and those kinds of feats instead of the bow focus, but decided not to because immunities are better. Focus in Xbow if you like, but it isn't req'd really.
My original comment was a bit tongue-in-cheek, Max... just grasping to help make the build more unique than others but now thinking about it longer, I'd stick with Xbow and take Imp Crit (for DevCrit, naturally) to reach 17-20 crit range which is better than the waraxe's imp'd range. (Throw in Rapid Reload, if you have a spare feat.) Even if there is a marked advantage in available props on longbows vs. xbows (like higher Mighty enhancements), the crit range will matter most in a build like this.

Against lichs, constructs, etc. a DevCrit build will ALWAYS pale unless bolstered by divine buffs, so in that case neither weapon will be all that much better outside the AB difference. I'm considering more against those pesky mages and slaads that erect acid sheath & other recipro shields. Let 'em. Then pull out the Xbow and end the problem without getting any dirt under your fingernails. Mages & slaads have notoriously poor fort save levels so, depending on whether your server has noodled around with DevCrit or not, it should one-crit-kill very nicely. If you are having a tough time hitting any, switch to DEX gear since the high DC wouldn't be needed against those sort of foes (your innate mundane DC should be plenty).

You can still separate mobs with bolts, of course, but have an effective recourse vs. those sticky situations mentioned above.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
How about giving up 2 AB and 4 pre-epic feats to take 4 Bard and 4 RDD pre-epic, so you can get some of the RDD goodies much earlier? You would also get some earlier Bard skill dumps. Also, you would have room for 4 more epic Fighter levels, so you could get the missing Epic Weapon Spec and Epic Prowess (which would restore one of the lost points of AB).

One more minor detail: RDD has Spellcraft as a class skill, so you don't have to wait until level 39 to put points in Spellcraft.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
My suggestion would replace 8 pre-epic levels of Fighter with 4 Bard and 4 RDD, losing 4 pre-epic feats. Max basically said he had so many pre-epic feats he didn't know what to do with them all (I paraphrase). It would be up to Max which feats to lose.

Since 4 RDD levels are moved to pre-epic, that creates a 4-slot hole in epic to be filled with Fighter levels, as I described. You would wind up with Fighter 24 / Bard 6 / RDD 10, and at level 20, it would be Fighter 12 / Bard 4 / RDD 4. The final AB would be only 1 less, thanks to addition of Epic Prowess.

Four RDD levels gets you +4 STR, not just +2. Also, because when you start taking RDD levels in epic, you'll be starting with the 5th level of RDD instead the 1st, my suggestion could result in reaching RDD 10, with all the goodies that brings, four levels earlier. This would depend on when you take those "extra" epic levels of Fighter (the 4 levels of Fighter displaced from pre-epic to epic by the 4 moved levels of RDD).

An idea just occurred to me, He could opt to have only 2 pre-epic levels of Bard instead of 4, ending with Fighter 26 / Bard 4 / RDD 10, with one fewer lost pre-epic feats, and no change in BAB from my original suggestion. This way at level 20, you would have Fighter 14 / Bard 2 / RDD 4. This is probably a better idea than my first suggestion.

If I am still being confusing, I could whip up the revised build I am talking about, once I am told which 3 pre-epic feats Max chooses to lose.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
OK, one at a time.

@ Hip

My bad, I did see both, and I remember Mick's build was the one that was more to my liking, but I had seen the other one first, so my brain made mashed potatoes with that info and my memory betrayed me.

I took the first Bard at 24 because he has -2 CHA modifier, which means that a UMD update would end up one lower total than it could be, since I don't plan on wearing any CHA gear. That has many implications on WoG, since most of the desireable magic items need over 20 UMD to be worn. Anyhow, that's indeed minor. I am stil undecided whether to relinquish 1 AB for devcrit with another weapon. I can see the merit in it, but I can't see its usefulness in my playstyle. I'll make reference to that as a very interesting tweak if it suits a certain playstyle. I seriously barely use bows with STR toons, cuz the AB with them is just so much lower than your melee AB that if you're fighting anything in your level range, you'll miss on 3 out of 4 APR and do 5 damage on the one you hit.

@ Empyre65

I would be willing to drop PRE-EPIC feats, absolutely, what I wouldn't be willing to drop is BAB, and my build DOES get Epic Prowess, at lvl 40, true, because it's not really all that needed. It ends with 50 AB naked +5 from GMW (which I can get in a wand as long as I can buy one, I even have a supplier already on WoG), +6 from Capped STR, +1 from Bless and +1 from Aid potions that's 63 AB, which is above par on WoG. I also know of a place to buy True Strike scrolls for those battles where that AB isn't enough to constantly hit the opponent.

As for the spellcraft, thanks, that was really helpful. The colors in the CBC mix up in my eyes. They could've made the difference in Class / Cross Class skills more perceptible to the Human eye by filling the cells that correspond to the cross-class skills with a better color. Anyhow, I will make that change right now. And I will revise the build to try to get other useful feats in, relinquishing the ranged weapon focus altogether. If that one ends up worse than this one, then I will try out Hip's suggestion and devcrit with a ranged weapon.

Thanks for the input. Now that I can't play for a while, I will have some time to work on that build. Cya soon!

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
@ Empyre65

All the tweaks you suggested pre-epic are not to my liking. I love cleave right from the start, it's the most useful feat until you get a second attack per round. I don't see why you'd even consider getting Disarm and Improved Disarm in different levels. Do you like receiving attacks of opportunity or were you simply planning on not using it for 2 levels? Blind Fight where I play is not needed till around level 15, but if you feel you need it earlier, it's very doable, just not at the expense of early Cleave IMO, and as for Toughness, I just dislike the feat. It gives you an extra HP per level, meh. Only reason I took it was because there was nothing better to get. These tweaks are minor, however, and could be easily implemented if they suit your playstyle.

Now as for you suggested post-epic tweaks, they're all good. In fact, there is a way to attain RDD goodies even earlier than what you've suggested. I've just noticed that, I will post an altered version shortly. Thanks for the help!

@ Mick

Sorry, mate, my bad

Take it EZ!
